t: Lamentations 1
Lament over Jerusalem
א Aleph
How*pn she sits alone, the*ln city once crowded with people! She*ln who was great among the nations has*ln become like a widow. The*ln princess among the provinces has*ln been put to forced labor.
ב Beth

She*pn weeps bitterly during the night, with*ln tears on her cheeks. There*ln is no one to offer her comfort, not*ln one from all her lovers. All*ln her friends have betrayed her; they*ln have become her enemies.
ג Gimel
Judah*pn has gone into exile following*ln affliction and harsh slavery; she*ln lives among the nations but*ln finds no place to rest. All*ln her pursuers have overtaken her in*ln narrow places.
ד Daleth
The*pn roads to Zion mourn, for*ln no one comes to the appointed festivals. All*ln her gates are deserted; her*ln priests groan, her*ln young women grieve, and*ln she herself is bitter.
ה He

Her*pn adversaries have become her masters; her*ln enemies are at ease, for*ln the Lord*s has made her suffer because*ln of her many transgressions. Her*ln children have gone away as*ln captives before the adversary.
ו Waw
All*pn the splendor has vanished from*ln Daughter Zion. Her*ln leaders are like stags that*ln find no pasture; they*ln stumble away exhausted before*ln the hunter.
ז Zayin

During*pn the days of her affliction and homelessness Jerusalem*ln remembers all her precious belongings that*ln were hers in days of old. When*ln her people fell into the adversary’s hand, she*ln had no one to help. The*ln adversaries looked at her, laughing*ln over her downfall.
ח Cheth
Jerusalem*pn has sinned grievously; therefore,*ln she has become an object of scorn. All*ln who honored her now despise her, for*ln they have seen her nakedness. She*ln herself groans and turns away.
ט Teth
Her*pn uncleanness stains her skirts. She*ln never considered her end. Her*ln downfall was astonishing; there*ln was no one to comfort her. Lord,*sln look on my affliction, for*ln the enemy boasts.
י Yod
The*pn adversary has seized all*ln her precious belongings. She*ln has even seen the nations enter*ln her sanctuary — those*ln you had forbidden to*ln enter your assembly.
כ Kaph
All*pn her people groan while*ln they search for bread. They*ln have traded their precious belongings for food in*ln order to stay alive. Lord,*sln look and see how*ln I have become despised.
ל Lamed
Is*pn this nothing to you, all you who pass by? Look*ln and see! Is*ln there any pain like mine, which*ln was dealt out to me, which*ln the Lord*s made me suffer on*ln the day of his burning anger?
מ Mem
He*pn sent fire from on high into my bones; he*ln made it descend. He*ln spread a net for my feet and*ln turned me back. He*ln made me desolate, sick*ln all day long.
נ Nun

My*pn transgressions have been formed into a yoke, fastened*ln together by his hand; they*ln have been placed on my neck, and*ln the Lord has broken my strength. He*ln has handed me over to*ln those I cannot withstand.
ס Samek

The*pn Lord has rejected all*ln the mighty men within me. He*ln has summoned an army against me to*ln crush my young warriors. The*ln Lord has trampled Virgin Daughter Judah like*ln grapes in a winepress.
ע Ayin
I*pn weep because of these things; my*ln eyes flow with tears. For*ln there is no one nearby to comfort me, no*ln one to keep me alive. My*ln children are desolate because*ln the enemy has prevailed.
פ Pe

Zion*pn stretches out her hands; there*ln is no one to comfort her. The*ln Lord*s has issued a decree against Jacob that*ln his neighbors should be his adversaries. Jerusalem*ln has become something*ln impure among them.
צ Tsade
The*pn Lord*s is just, for*ln I have rebelled against his command. Listen,*ln all you people; look*ln at my pain. My*ln young women and young men have*ln gone into captivity.
ק Qoph
I*pn called to my lovers, but*ln they betrayed me. My*ln priests and elders perished*ln in the city while*ln searching for food to*ln keep themselves alive.
ר Resh
Lord,*spn see how I am in distress. I*ln am churning within; my*ln heart is broken, for*ln I have been very rebellious. Outside,*ln the sword takes the children; inside,*ln there is death.
שׁ Shin

People*pn have heard me groaning, but*ln there is no one to comfort me. All*ln my enemies have heard of my misfortune; they*ln are glad that you have caused it. Bring*ln on the day you have announced, so*ln that they may become like me.
ת Taw
Let*pn all their wickedness come before you, and*ln deal with them as*ln you have dealt with me because*ln of all my transgressions. For*ln my groans are many, and*ln I am sick at heart.
Lamentations 2
Judgment on Jerusalem
א Aleph
How*pn the Lord has overshadowed Daughter*ln Zion with his anger! He*ln has thrown down Israel’s glory from*ln heaven to earth. He*ln did not acknowledge his footstool in*ln the day of his anger.
ב Beth

Without*pn compassion the Lord has swallowed up all*ln the dwellings of Jacob. In*ln his wrath he has demolished the*ln fortified cities of Daughter Judah. He*ln brought them to the ground and*ln defiled the kingdom and its leaders.
ג Gimel

He*pn has cut off every horn of Israel in*ln his burning anger and*ln withdrawn his right hand in*ln the presence of the enemy. He*ln has blazed against Jacob like a flaming fire that*ln consumes everything.
ד Daleth

He*pn has strung his bow like an enemy; his*ln right hand is positioned like an adversary. He*ln has killed everyone who was the delight to the eye, pouring*ln out his wrath like fire on*ln the tent of Daughter Zion.
ה He

The*pn Lord is like an enemy; he*ln has swallowed up Israel. He*ln swallowed up all its palaces and*ln destroyed its fortified cities. He*ln has multiplied mourning and lamentation within*ln Daughter Judah.
ו Waw

He*pn has wrecked his temple as*ln if it were merely a shack in a field, destroying*ln his place of meeting. The*ln Lord*s has abolished appointed*ln festivals and Sabbaths in Zion. He*ln has despised king and priest in*ln his fierce anger.
ז Zayin

The*pn Lord has rejected his altar, repudiated*ln his sanctuary; he*ln has handed the walls of her palaces over*ln to the enemy. They*ln have raised a shout in the house of the Lord*s as*ln on the day of an appointed festival.
ח Cheth

The*pn Lord*s determined to destroy the*ln wall of Daughter Zion. He*ln stretched out a measuring line and*ln did not restrain himself from destroying. He*ln made the ramparts and walls grieve; together*ln they waste away.
ט Teth

Zion’s*pn gates have fallen to the ground; he*ln has destroyed and shattered the bars on her gates. Her*ln king and her leaders live among the nations, instruction*ln is no more, and*ln even her prophets receive no*ln vision from the Lord.*s
י Yod

The*pn elders of Daughter Zion sit*ln on the ground in silence. They*ln have thrown dust on their heads and*ln put on sackcloth. The*ln young women of Jerusalem have*ln bowed their heads to the ground.
כ Kaph

My*pn eyes are worn out from weeping; I*ln am churning within. My*ln heart is poured out in grief because*ln of the destruction of my dear people, because*ln infants and nursing babies faint in*ln the streets of the city.
ל Lamed
They*pn cry out to their mothers, “Where*ln is the grain and wine?” as*ln they faint like the wounded in*ln the streets of the city, as*ln their life pours out in*ln the arms of their mothers.
מ Mem

What*pn can I say on your behalf? What*ln can I compare you to, Daughter Jerusalem? What*ln can I liken you to, so*ln that I may console you, Virgin Daughter Zion? For*ln your ruin is as vast as the sea. Who*ln can heal you?
נ Nun

Your*pn prophets saw visions for you that*ln were empty and deceptive; they*ln did not reveal your iniquity and*ln so restore your fortunes. They*ln saw pronouncements for you that*ln were empty and misleading.
ס Samek

All*pn who pass by scornfully*ln clap their hands at you. They*ln hiss and shake their heads at*ln Daughter Jerusalem: Is*ln this the city that was called the*ln perfection of beauty, the*ln joy of the whole earth?
פ Pe
All*pn your enemies open*ln their mouths against you. They*ln hiss and gnash their teeth, saying,*ln “We have swallowed her up. This*ln is the day we have waited for! We*ln have lived to see it.”
ע Ayin

The*pn Lord*s has done what he planned; he*ln has accomplished his decree, which*ln he ordained in days of old. He*ln has demolished without compassion, letting*ln the enemy gloat over you and*ln exalting the horn of your adversaries.
צ Tsade
The*pn hearts of the people cry out to the Lord. Wall*ln of Daughter Zion, let*ln your tears run down like a river day*ln and night. Give*ln yourself no relief and*ln your eyes no rest.
ק Qoph

Arise,*pn cry out in the night from*ln the first watch of the night. Pour*ln out your heart like water before*ln the Lord’s presence. Lift*ln up your hands to him for*ln the lives of your children who*ln are fainting from hunger at*ln the head of every street.
ר Resh

Lord,*spn look and consider to*ln whom you have done this. Should*ln women eat their own children, the*ln infants they have nurtured? Should*ln priests and prophets be*ln killed in the Lord’s sanctuary?
שׁ Shin

Both*pn young and old are*ln lying on the ground in the streets. My*ln young women and young men have*ln fallen by the sword. You*ln have killed them in the day of your anger, slaughtering*ln without compassion.
ת Taw

You*pn summon those who terrorize me on every side, as*ln if for an appointed festival day; on*ln the day of the Lord’s*s anger no*ln one escaped or survived. My*ln enemy has destroyed those*ln I nurtured and reared.
Lamentations 3
Hope through God’s Mercy
א Aleph
I*pn am the man who has seen affliction under*ln the rod of God’s wrath.
He*ln has driven me away and forced me to walk in*ln darkness instead of light.
Yes,*ln he repeatedly turns his hand against*ln me all day long.
ב Beth
He*pn has worn away my flesh and skin; he*ln has broken my bones.
He*ln has laid siege against me, encircling*ln me with bitterness and hardship.
He*ln has made me dwell in darkness like*ln those who have been dead for ages.
ג Gimel
He*pn has walled me in so I cannot get out; he*ln has weighed me down with chains.
Even*ln when I cry out and plead for help, he*ln blocks out my prayer.
He*ln has walled in my ways with blocks of stone; he*ln has made my paths crooked.
ד Daleth
He*pn is a bear waiting in ambush, a*ln lion in hiding.
He*ln forced me off my way and tore me to pieces; he*ln left me desolate.
He*ln strung his bow and*ln set me as the target for his arrow.
ה He
He*pn pierced my kidneys with*ln shafts from his quiver.
I*ln am a laughingstock to all my people, mocked*ln by their songs all day long.
He*ln filled me with bitterness, satiated*ln me with wormwood.
ו Waw
He*pn ground my teeth with gravel and*ln made me cower in the dust.
I*ln have been deprived of peace; I*ln have forgotten what prosperity is.
Then*ln I thought, “My future is lost, as*ln well as my hope from the Lord.”*s
ז Zayin
Remember*pn my affliction and my homelessness, the*ln wormwood and the poison.
I*ln continually remember them and*ln have become depressed.
Yet*ln I call this to mind, and*ln therefore I have hope:
ח Cheth
Because*pn of the Lord’s*s faithful love we*ln do not perish, for*ln his mercies never end.
They*ln are new every morning; great*ln is your faithfulness!
I*ln say, “The Lord*s is my portion, therefore*ln I will put my hope in him.”
ט Teth
The*pn Lord*s is good to those who wait for him, to*ln the person who seeks him.
It*ln is good to wait quietly for*ln salvation from the Lord.*s
It*ln is good for a man to bear the yoke while*ln he is still young.
י Yod
Let*pn him sit alone and be silent, for*ln God has disciplined him.
Let*ln him put his mouth in the dust— perhaps*ln there is still hope.
Let*ln him offer his cheek to*ln the one who would strike him; let*ln him be filled with disgrace.
כ Kaph
For*pn the Lord will*ln not reject us forever.
Even*ln if he causes suffering, he*ln will show compassion according*ln to the abundance of his faithful love.
For*ln he does not enjoy bringing affliction or*ln suffering on mankind.
ל Lamed
Crushing*pn all the prisoners of the land beneath*ln one’s feet,
denying*ln justice to a man in*ln the presence of the Most High,
or*ln subverting a person in his lawsuit— the*ln Lord does not approve of these things.
מ Mem
Who*pn is there who speaks and it happens, unless*ln the Lord has ordained it?
Do*ln not both adversity and good come*ln from the mouth of the Most High?
Why*ln should any living person complain, any*ln man, because of the punishment for his sins?
נ Nun
Let’s*pn examine and probe our ways, and*ln turn back to the Lord.*s
Let’s*ln lift up our hearts and our hands to*ln God in heaven:
“We*ln have sinned and rebelled; you*ln have not forgiven.
ס Samek
“You*pn have covered yourself in anger and pursued us; you*ln have killed without compassion.
You*ln have covered yourself with a cloud so*ln that no prayer can get through.
You*ln have made us disgusting filth among*ln the peoples.
פ Pe
“All*pn our enemies open*ln their mouths against us.
We*ln have experienced panic and pitfall, devastation*ln and destruction.”
My*ln eyes flow with streams of tears because*ln of the destruction of my dear people.
ע Ayin
My*pn eyes overflow unceasingly, without*ln end,
until*ln the Lord*s looks down from*ln heaven and sees.
My*ln eyes bring me grief because*ln of the fate of all the women in my city.
צ Tsade
For*pn no reason, my enemies hunted*ln me like a bird.
They*ln smothered my life in a pit and*ln threw stones on me.
Water*ln flooded over my head, and*ln I thought, “I’m going to die!”
ק Qoph
I*pn called on your name, Lord,*s from*ln the depths of the pit.
You*ln heard my plea: Do*ln not ignore my cry for relief.
You*ln came near whenever I called you; you*ln said, “Do not be afraid.”
ר Resh
You*pn championed my cause, Lord; you*ln redeemed my life.
Lord,*sln you saw the wrong done to me; judge*ln my case.
You*ln saw all their vengefulness, all*ln their plots against me.
שׂ Sin / שׁ Shin
Lord,*spn you heard their insults, all*ln their plots against me.
The*ln slander and murmuring of my opponents attack*ln me all day long.
When*ln they sit and when they rise, look, I*ln am mocked by their songs.
ת Taw
You*pn will pay them back what they deserve, Lord,*s according*ln to the work of their hands.
You*ln will give them a heart filled with anguish. May*ln your curse be on them!
You*ln will pursue them in anger and destroy them under*ln your heavens.
Lamentations 4
Terrors of the Besieged City
א Aleph
How*pn the gold has become tarnished, the*ln fine gold become dull! The*ln stones of the temple lie scattered at*ln the head of every street.
ב Beth
Zion’s*pn precious children — once*ln worth their weight in pure gold— how*ln they are regarded as clay jars, the*ln work of a potter’s hands!
ג Gimel
Even*pn jackals offer their breasts to*ln nurse their young, but*ln my dear people have become cruel like*ln ostriches in the wilderness.
ד Daleth
The*pn nursing baby’s tongue clings*ln to the roof of his mouth from thirst. Infants*ln beg for food, but*ln no one gives them any.
ה He
Those*pn who used to eat delicacies are*ln destitute in the streets; those*ln who were reared in purple garments huddle*ln in trash heaps.
ו Waw
The*pn punishment of my dear people is*ln greater than that of Sodom, which*ln was overthrown in an instant without*ln a hand laid on it.
ז Zayin
Her*pn dignitaries were brighter than snow, whiter*ln than milk; their*ln bodies were more ruddy than coral, their*ln appearance like lapis lazuli.
ח Cheth
Now*pn they appear darker than soot; they*ln are not recognized in the streets. Their*ln skin has shriveled on their bones; it*ln has become dry like wood.
ט Teth
Those*pn slain by the sword are better off than*ln those slain by hunger, who*ln waste away, pierced with pain because*ln the fields lack produce.
י Yod
The*pn hands of compassionate women have*ln cooked their own children; they*ln became their food during*ln the destruction of my dear people.
כ Kaph
The*pn Lord*s has exhausted his wrath, poured*ln out his burning anger; he*ln has ignited a fire in Zion, and*ln it has consumed her foundations.
ל Lamed
The*pn kings of the earth and*ln all the world’s inhabitants did not believe that*ln an enemy or adversary could*ln enter Jerusalem’s gates.
מ Mem
Yet*pn it happened because of the sins of her prophets and*ln the iniquities of her priests, who*ln shed the blood of the righteous within her.
נ Nun
Blind,*pn they stumbled in the streets, defiled*ln by this blood, so*ln that no one dared to*ln touch their garments.
ס Samek
“Stay*pn away! Unclean!” people shouted at them. “Away,*ln away! Don’t touch us!” So*ln they wandered aimlessly. It*ln was said among the nations, “They*ln can stay here no longer.”
פ Pe
The*pn Lord*s himself has scattered them; he*ln no longer watches over them. The*ln priests are not respected; the*ln elders find no favor.
ע Ayin
All*pn the while our eyes were failing as*ln we looked in vain for help; we*ln watched from our towers for*ln a nation that would not save us.
צ Tsade
Our*pn steps were closely followed so*ln that we could not walk in our streets. Our*ln end approached; our time ran out. Our*ln end had come!
ק Qoph
Those*pn who chased us were swifter than*ln eagles in the sky; they*ln relentlessly pursued us over the mountains and*ln ambushed us in the wilderness.
ר Resh
The*pn Lord’s*s anointed, the breath of our life, was*ln captured in their traps. We*ln had said about him, “We*ln will live under his protection among the nations.”
שׂ Sin
So*pn rejoice and be glad, Daughter Edom, you*ln resident of the land of Uz! Yet*ln the cup will pass to you as well; you*ln will get drunk and expose yourself.
ת Taw
Daughter*pn Zion, your punishment is complete; he*ln will not lengthen your exile. But*ln he will punish your iniquity, Daughter Edom, and*ln will expose your sins.
Lamentations 5
Prayer for Restoration
Lord,*spn remember what has happened to us. Look,*ln and see our disgrace!
Our*ln inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our*ln houses to foreigners.
We*ln have become orphans, fatherless; our*ln mothers are widows.
We*ln must pay for the water we drink; our*ln wood comes at a price.
We*ln are closely pursued; we*ln are tired, and no one offers us rest.
We*ln made a treaty with Egypt and*ln with Assyria, to get enough food.
Our*ln ancestors sinned; they no longer exist, but*ln we bear their punishment.
Slaves*ln rule over us; no*ln one rescues us from them.
We*ln secure our food at the risk of our lives because*ln of the sword in the wilderness.
Our*ln skin is as hot as an oven from*ln the ravages of hunger.
Women*ln have been raped in Zion, virgins*ln in the cities of Judah.
Princes*ln have been hung up by their hands; elders*ln are shown no respect.
Young*ln men labor at millstones; boys*ln stumble under loads of wood.
The*ln elders have left the city gate, the*ln young men, their music.
Joy*ln has left our hearts; our*ln dancing has turned to mourning.
The*ln crown has fallen from our head. Woe*ln to us, for we have sinned.
Because*ln of this, our heart is sick; because*ln of these, our eyes grow dim:
because*ln of Mount Zion, which lies desolate and*ln has jackals prowling in it.
You,*ln Lord,*s are enthroned forever; your*ln throne endures from generation to generation.
Why*ln do you continually forget us, abandon*ln us for our entire lives?
Lord,*sln bring us back to yourself, so we may return; renew*ln our days as in former times,
unless*ln you have completely rejected us and*ln are intensely angry with us.
